user_query: Show the first name and the email address of customer with CompanyName 'Bike World'
actual_sql: SELECT firstname, emailaddress FROM SalesLT.Customer WHERE companyname = 'Bike World'
generated_sql: SQLQuery: SELECT FirstName, EmailAddress FROM [SalesLT].[Customer] WHERE CompanyName = 'Bike World'

user_query: Give the CompanyName of those customers with orders over $100000. Include the subtotal plus tax plus freight
actual_sql: SELECT companyname FROM SalesLT.Customer c JOIN SalesLT.SalesOrderHeader sh ON c.customerid = sh.customerid WHERE subtotal + taxamt + freight > 100000
generated_sql: SELECT C.CompanyName, (SOH.SubTotal + SOH.TaxAmt + SOH.Freight) AS OrderTotal FROM [SalesLT].[Customer] C INNER JOIN [SalesLT].[SalesOrderHeader] SOH ON C.CustomerID = SOH.CustomerID WHERE (SOH.SubTotal + SOH.TaxAmt + SOH.Freight) > 100000 ORDER BY OrderTotal DESC

user_query: Show the SalesOrderID and the UnitPrice for every Single Item Order
actual_sql: WITH temp1 AS (SELECT salesorderid, SUM(OrderQty) AS items FROM SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail GROUP BY salesorderid HAVING SUM(OrderQty) = 1) SELECT salesorderid, unitprice FROM SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail WHERE salesorderid IN (SELECT salesorderid FROM temp1)
generated_sql: SELECT SalesOrderID, UnitPrice FROM [SalesLT].[SalesOrderDetail] WHERE OrderQty = 1

user_query: Show the product description for culture 'fr' for product with ProductID 736
actual_sql: SELECT description FROM SalesLT.Product p JOIN SalesLT.ProductModel pm ON p.productmodelid = pm.productmodelid JOIN SalesLT.ProductModelProductDescription pmpd ON pm.productmodelid = pmpd.productmodelid JOIN SalesLT.ProductDescription pd ON pmpd.productdescriptionid = pd.productdescriptionid WHERE (productid = 736) AND (culture = 'fr')
generated_sql: SELECT pd.Description FROM [SalesLT].[Product] p INNER JOIN [SalesLT].[ProductModelProductDescription] pmpd ON p.ProductModelID = pmpd.ProductModelID INNER JOIN [SalesLT].[ProductDescription] pd ON pmpd.ProductDescriptionID = pd.ProductDescriptionID WHERE p.ProductID = 736 AND pmpd.Culture = 'fr'

user_query: How many products in ProductCategory 'Cranksets' have been sold to an address in 'London'?
actual_sql: SELECT SUM(orderqty) total FROM SalesLT.Address a JOIN SalesLT.SalesOrderHeader sh ON a.addressid = sh.billtoaddressid JOIN SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail sd ON sh.salesorderid = sd.salesorderid JOIN SalesLT.Product p ON sd.productid = p.productid JOIN SalesLT.ProductCategory pc ON p.productcategoryid = pc.productcategoryid WHERE (city = 'London') AND (pc.name = 'Cranksets');
generated_sql: SELECT pd.Description FROM [SalesLT].[Product] p INNER JOIN [SalesLT].[ProductModelProductDescription] pmpd ON p.ProductModelID = pmpd.ProductModelID INNER JOIN [SalesLT].[ProductDescription] pd ON pmpd.ProductDescriptionID = pd.ProductDescriptionID WHERE p.ProductID = 736 AND pmpd.Culture = 'fr'

user_query: For every customer with a 'Main Office' in Dallas show AddressLine1 of the 'Main Office' and AddressLine1 of the 'Shipping' address. If there is no shipping address leave it blank. Use one row per customer
actual_sql: SQLQuery: SELECT c.CustomerID, mo.AddressLine1 AS MainOfficeAddress, sh.AddressLine1 AS ShippingAddress FROM [SalesLT].[Customer] c INNER JOIN [SalesLT].[CustomerAddress] camo ON c.CustomerID = camo.CustomerID AND camo.AddressType = 'Main Office' INNER JOIN [SalesLT].[Address] mo ON camo.AddressID = mo.AddressID AND mo.City = 'Dallas' LEFT JOIN [SalesLT].[CustomerAddress] cash ON c.CustomerID = cash.CustomerID AND cash.AddressType = 'Shipping' LEFT JOIN [SalesLT].[Address] sh ON cash.AddressID = sh.AddressID
generated_sql: SELECT c.FirstName, c.LastName, mo.AddressLine1 AS MainOfficeAddressLine1, sh.AddressLine1 AS ShippingAddressLine1 FROM [SalesLT].[Customer] c LEFT JOIN [SalesLT].[CustomerAddress] moa ON c.CustomerID = moa.CustomerID AND moa.AddressType = 'Main Office' LEFT JOIN [SalesLT].[Address] mo ON moa.AddressID = mo.AddressID AND mo.City = 'Dallas' LEFT JOIN [SalesLT].[CustomerAddress] sha ON c.CustomerID = sha.CustomerID AND sha.AddressType = 'Shipping' LEFT JOIN [SalesLT].[Address] sh ON sha.AddressID = sh.AddressID WHERE mo.AddressLine1 IS NOT NULL AND sh.AddressLine1 IS NOT NULL

user_query: Show the best selling item by value
actual_sql: SELECT TOP 1 name, SUM(orderqty * unitprice) total_value FROM SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail sd JOIN SalesLT.Product p ON sd.productid = p.productid GROUP BY name ORDER BY total_value DESC
generated_sql: SELECT TOP 1 p.ProductID, p.Name, SUM(sod.OrderQty * sod.UnitPrice) AS TotalValue FROM [SalesLT].[SalesOrderDetail] AS sod JOIN [SalesLT].[Product] AS p ON sod.ProductID = p.ProductID GROUP BY p.ProductID, p.Name ORDER BY TotalValue DESC

user_query: Identify the three most important cities. Show the break down of top level product category against city
actual_sql: WITH temp1 AS (SELECT TOP 3 city, SUM(unitprice * orderqty) AS total_sales FROM SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail sd JOIN SalesLT.SalesOrderHeader sh ON sd.salesorderid = sh.salesorderid   JOIN SalesLT.Address a ON sh.shiptoaddressid = a.addressid GROUP BY city ORDER BY total_sales DESC) SELECT city, pc.name, SUM(unitprice * orderqty) total_sales FROM SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail sd JOIN SalesLT.SalesOrderHeader sh ON sd.salesorderid = sh.salesorderid JOIN SalesLT.Address a ON sh.shiptoaddressid = a.addressid JOIN SalesLT.Product p ON sd.productid = p.productid JOIN SalesLT.ProductCategory pc ON p.productcategoryid = pc.productcategoryid WHERE city IN (SELECT city FROM temp1) GROUP BY city, pc.name ORDER BY city, total_sales DESC
generated_sql: WITH temp1 AS (SELECT TOP 3 city, SUM(unitprice * orderqty) AS total_sales FROM SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail sd JOIN SalesLT.SalesOrderHeader sh ON sd.salesorderid = sh.salesorderid   JOIN SalesLT.Address a ON sh.shiptoaddressid = a.addressid GROUP BY city ORDER BY total_sales DESC) SELECT city, pc.name, SUM(unitprice * orderqty) total_sales FROM SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail sd JOIN SalesLT.SalesOrderHeader sh ON sd.salesorderid = sh.salesorderid JOIN SalesLT.Address a ON sh.shiptoaddressid = a.addressid JOIN SalesLT.Product p ON sd.productid = p.productid JOIN SalesLT.ProductCategory pc ON p.productcategoryid = pc.productcategoryid WHERE city IN (SELECT city FROM temp1) GROUP BY city, pc.name ORDER BY city, total_sales DESC

user_query: Find the best customer in each region
actual_sql: WITH temp1 (countryregion, companyname, total_sales, rnk) AS (SELECT countryregion, companyname, SUM(subtotal) AS total_sales, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY countryregion ORDER BY SUM(subtotal) DESC) rnk FROM SalesLT.Address a JOIN SalesLT.SalesOrderHeader sh ON a.addressid = sh.shiptoaddressid JOIN SalesLT.Customer c ON sh.customerid = c.customerid GROUP BY countryregion, companyname) SELECT countryregion, companyname, total_sales FROM temp1 WHERE rnk = 1
generated_sql: SELECT c.CustomerID, c.FirstName, c.LastName, SUM(soh.TotalDue) AS TotalSpent FROM [SalesLT].[Customer] c INNER JOIN [SalesLT].[SalesOrderHeader] soh ON c.CustomerID = soh.CustomerID INNER JOIN [SalesLT].[CustomerAddress] ca ON c.CustomerID = ca.CustomerID GROUP BY c.CustomerID, c.FirstName, c.LastName, ca.AddressType ORDER BY ca.AddressType, TotalSpent DESC

user_query: Show the total order value for each CountryRegion. List by value with the highest first
actual_sql: SELECT countryregion, SUM(subtotal) total FROM SalesLT.Address a JOIN SalesLT.SalesOrderHeader sh ON a.addressid = sh.shiptoaddressid GROUP BY countryregion
generated_sql: SELECT a.CountryRegion, SUM(soh.TotalDue) AS TotalOrderValue FROM [SalesLT].[Address] a JOIN [SalesLT].[SalesOrderHeader] soh ON a.AddressID = soh.ShipToAddressID OR a.AddressID = soh.BillToAddressID GROUP BY a.CountryRegion ORDER BY TotalOrderValue DESC
